row.PT-Gloss: falar de forma rápida e incessantemente (normalmente sobre assuntos sem importância)

row.EN-Gloss: the act of delaying; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time
row.PT-Gloss: o ato de atrasar; inatividade resultando em algo que está sendo adiado para um momento posterior

row.EN-Gloss: talk socially without exchanging too much information; "the men were sitting in the cafe and shooting the breeze"
row.EN-Words: chaffer, chat, chatter, chew the fat, chit-chat, chitchat, claver, confab, confabulate, gossip, jaw, natter, shoot the breeze, visit
row.PT-Gloss: falar socialmente sem trocar muita informação; "os homens estavam sentados no café batendo papo"

row.EN-Gloss: act or practice of refraining from indulging an appetite
row.PT-Gloss: ato ou prática de se abster de satisfazer um apetite

row.EN-Gloss: abstaining from food
row.PT-Gloss: se abster da comida

row.EN-Gloss: make a whining, ringing, or whistling sound; "the kettle was singing"; "the bullet sang past his ear"
row.PT-Gloss: fazer um gemido, zunido ou som de assobio; "a chaleira estava cantando"; "a bala sibilou do lado de sua orelha"

row.EN-Gloss: speak softly or indistinctly; "She murmured softly to the baby in her arms"
row.PT-Gloss: falar baixinho ou indistintamente; "Ela murmurou baixinho para o bebê nos braços"

row.EN-Gloss: talk indistinctly; usually in a low voice
row.PT-Gloss: falar indistintamente; geralmente em voz baixa

row.EN-Gloss: the act of hindering or obstructing or impeding
row.PT-Gloss: o ato de impedir ou obstruir

row.EN-Gloss: make a loud noise, as of wind, water, or vehicles; "The wind was howling in the trees"; "The water roared down the chute"
row.PT-Gloss: fazer um barulho alto, como de vento, água ou veículos; "O vento estava rugindo nas árvores"; "A água rugiu pela calha"

row.EN-Gloss: the act of obstructing; "obstruction of justice"
row.PT-Gloss: o ato de obstruir; "obstrução da justiça"

row.EN-Gloss: speak in an unfriendly tone; "She barked into the dictaphone"
row.PT-Gloss: falar em um tom hostil; "Ela bradou para o ditafone"

row.EN-Gloss: make barking sounds; "The dogs barked at the stranger"
row.PT-Gloss: fazer sons de latido; "Os cachorros latiram para o estrangeiro"

row.EN-Gloss: the act of stopping something; "the third baseman made some remarkable stops"; "his stoppage of the flow resulted in a flood"
row.PT-Gloss: o ato de parar alguma coisa; "jogador de beisebol fez algumas paralizações notáveis"; "a paralisação do fluxo resultou em uma inundação "

row.EN-Gloss: sing or play with trills, alternating with the half note above or below
talk in a noisy, excited, or declamatory manner
row.EN-Words: jabber, mouth off, rabbit on, rant, rave, spout
row.PT-Gloss: falar de uma forma barulhenta, animada ou declamatória

row.EN-Gloss: action taken by a group of people
the act of distributing or spreading or apportioning
the act of distributing by allotting or apportioning; distribution according to a plan; "the apportionment of seats in the House of Representatives is based on the relative population of each state"
row.EN-Words: allocation, allotment, apportioning, apportionment, assignation, parceling, parcelling
row.SPA-Words-Sug: asignación, parcelación, adjudicación, repartición, prorrateo, reparto

row.EN-Gloss: sing with closed lips; "She hummed a melody"
pronounce with a roll, of the phoneme /r/; "She rolls her r's"
the allotment of some amount by dividing something; "death gets more than its share of attention from theologians"
a distribution in shares
the act of giving
make a crushing noise; "his shoes were crunching on the gravel"
refuse to acknowledge; "She cut him dead at the meeting"
make a characteristic sound, of a horse
serve as a means for expressing something; "The painting of Mary carries motherly love"; "His voice carried a lot of anger"
transactions (sales and purchases) having the objective of supplying commodities (goods and services)
request the participation or presence of; "The organizers invite submissions of papers for the conference"
communicate; "I'd like to share this idea with you"
the activity of providing goods and services involving financial and commercial and industrial aspects; "computers are now widely used in business"

row.PT-Word-Cand: actividades empresariais, actividades comerciais, actividades económicas
row.EN-Gloss: activity undertaken as part of a commercial enterprise
the volume of commercial activity; "business is good today"; "show me where the business was today"
the business given to a commercial establishment by its customers; "even before noon there was a considerable patronage"
